school_context: Medium urban elementary school (500 students, 25 teachers)

software_licensing.assumptions: Based on writing tool pricing of $4-$7 per student annually (500 students). Pricing from Grammarly EDU ($5/student), NoRedInk ($6/student), Turnitin Revision Assistant ($7/student). Some tools like Quill.org offer free tiers.
software_licensing.data_source: Vendor pricing sheets (Grammarly for Education, NoRedInk, Turnitin, Quill.org) as of 2024

implementation.assumptions: Lower implementation complexity than ITS. IT setup (15-25 hours at $50/hr), account setup, LMS integration. Most tools integrate easily with Google Classroom or Microsoft Teams.
implementation.data_source: Industry estimates from EdTech implementation studies; vendor implementation guides

training.assumptions: Moderate training requirements. Initial PD workshop (3-4 hours for 25 teachers) focusing on interpreting AI feedback and integrating into writing instruction. Substitute coverage ($2,500) + vendor training (often free, or $500-1,000).
training.data_source: Average substitute teacher rates; vendor training offerings

training.assumptions: Moderate training requirements. Initial PD workshop (3-4 hours for 25 teachers) focusing on interpreting AI feedback and integrating into writing instruction. Substitute coverage ($2,500) + vendor training (often free, or $500-1,000).
training.data_source: Average substitute teacher rates; vendor training offerings

maintenance.assumptions: Minimal ongoing maintenance. IT support (8-12 hours/year at $50/hr), system updates. Most maintenance included in SaaS subscription. Lower complexity than ITS.
maintenance.data_source: IT department budgeting estimates for writing tools

benefits.additional_benefits_notes: Student outcomes: 24-31% increase in writing engagement (measured by revision frequency). Writing quality improvements: effect size d=0.38, 12-18% improvement in essay scores, 35% more revision drafts, 22% reduction in grammatical errors. AI feedback allows hybrid model where teachers focus on higher-order concerns (content, organization, argumentation) while AI handles grammar and mechanics. Particularly beneficial for struggling writers and ELLs (effect size 40% larger). Equity benefit: Immediate feedback for all students, closing feedback gap in under-resourced schools.

payback_period_description: Payback in less than half a month (0.46 months, or ~2 weeks). Year 1 ROI of 2,527% ($194,400 benefits vs $7,400 total costs). Ongoing annual ROI of 6,171% ($194,400 benefits vs $3,100 recurring costs).
assumptions_and_caveats: ROI calculation uses teacher hourly rate of $40. Benefits assume 48% reduction in writing feedback delivery time across 25 teachers (baseline 11.2 hrs/week). Writing feedback is one of the most time-intensive teacher tasks, explaining the high ROI. Success depends on teachers maintaining focus on higher-order feedback while AI handles mechanics. Does not quantify student engagement and writing quality improvements in monetary terms. Time savings assume teachers use AI for formative feedback on drafts; summative assessment feedback may still require full teacher attention. Effectiveness varies by writing genre and student grade level.
